\[Debugging\] Can't bind to {prop} since it isn't a know property of {node} - YouTube

Angular

159K subscribers

[\[Debugging\] Can't bind to {prop} since it isn't a know property of {node}](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wfLkB3RsSJM)

An error occurred while retrieving sharing information. Please try again later.

0:00

0:00 / 4:00
•Live

•

[Watch on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wfLkB3RsSJM "Watch on YouTube")

An attribute or property cannot be resolved during compilation.

This error arises when attempting to bind to a property that does not exist.
Any property binding must correspond to either:

- A native property on the HTML element, or
- An `@Input()` property of a component or directive applied to the element.

The runtime error for this is `NG0304: '${tagName}' is not a known element: …'`.

## [Debugging the error](https://angular.dev/errors/NG8002\#debugging-the-error)

Look at documentation for the specific [binding syntax](https://angular.dev/guide/templates) used. This is usually a typo or incorrect import.
There may also be a missing direction with property selector 'name' or missing input.
title: NG8002: Invalid Attribute • Angular
description: The web development framework for building modern apps.
